title: Kind and caring staff
body:
My mum and I took my dad to A&E as he had chest pains, and has previously had a heart attack. 
The security guard on the door was so kind to us, and my dad as he had to go in on his own - giving us regular (socially distanced) updates about how he was doing and whether the nurses/doctors had seen him yet. 
He was so lovely and empathetic towards us and our situation. I’m confident he is this kind towards others admitted to a&e/wards where their families can’t see them. 
I’m grateful for your act of kindness, and I’m mad with myself I didn’t get his name to mention! Thank you!! 
We attended A&E on 09/08/20 in the afternoon.

title: Lovely staff
body: I just had one of the worst months of my life and I can't tell how grateful I am for all the nurses and doctors in the A23 Ward. The waiting time to be seen sometimes can be exhausting, but true to be told, once I was called I got to meet the most lovely nurses. I wish I knew the names of some of them! The doctors were always really respectful. My journey finished today, but they definitely made all of this rough path slightly easier. Thank you so much!

title: Excellen Practice
body: Excellent reception staff, very attentive, kind and willing to go above and beyond. The doctors very professional, kind and caring. You truly are in a family surgery. My husband and I can't thank you enough for the support we both have had. Many thanks to all at Family surgery.

author: Suziecarerstef
title: My brother who has MS
body:
Fell backwards trapped his legs under him back in March 2020 ambulance came after 4 hours of phoning as carers couldn’t lift him in bed , he has been bed bound ever since. His doctor at Retford Primary care has been contacted several times and has made no effort to get his xrays , stating that their opinion is it’s probably MS reason why my brother is bed bound. He is ex army and had done over 800 parachute jumps and has had in the past 9 operations in his knees and is more than capable of recognising that it is the damage to his knees that causes him to be in bed , I know we have Covid 19 but if it’s ok for his carers to come in then surely it’s ok for his doctor to come and examine and or refer him for X-rays , this is no way to treat an army veteran .  
As well as this a physiotherapist came , told him about exercises he could do in bed also to roll up a towel under his knees, then didn’t turn up for next appt when phoned said they had forgot . Next appt he phoned when they were over an hour late and cancelled as he had taken off underwear to use catheter, third appt told the physiotherapist unless they could give him a guaranteed time there was no point in coming. This physiotherapist reported back to my brother's doctor at Retford that he has cancelled the last three appointments which was not the true story , I his sister was there on all these occasions so can verify that the physiotherapist did not turn up.  
I would appreciate a call to try and get him the help he needs

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: real name hidden
title: Referral to Dermatology Department - CUH
body:
I was referred to the Dermatology Department by a Dr at East Croydon Medical Centre over six weeks ago. A video assessment took place with a Dr in the Dermatology Department following two video assessments with a Dr at EC Medical Centre. The outcome was that I would receive a letter confirming an appointment to attend the Deramatology Department for treatment.  
Over three weeks ago I contacted reception at the Dermatology Department and was informed that my details were on the Dr's desk and the receptionist offered to call me back with details of an appointment.  
The receptionist intimated that she thought my condition was not a priority. I have received no further information and don't know whether the outcome of my assessment was deemed a non priority and therefore shelved.  
This morning I tried again to contact Dermatolgy Department to ask:  
1: Why no one has got back to me after waiting 3 weeks for a response.  
2. Confirmation that my treatment been shelved.  
3. Why an appointment letter has not been issued and received.  
4. An explanation for why my telephone call was on hold this morning for over 57 minutes before the call dialling tone switched to music then went silent.  
5. Why last Friday I received a text from UCH thanking me for attending an appointment. Which I had no notice of and didn't attend.  
I fully appreciate these are exceptional times. However I am disappointed by this shoddy service particularly after paying contributions through my salary to the NHS during my long career as a teacher. I am now 61 years old and have rarely needed treatment from the NHS I recognise I am very lucky. It is disappointing to learn that when I needed help from the NHS it has not been available to me.  
I am shocked and appalled by what appears to me to be a complete shambles of a service!  
Please advise.

author: P14466078
title: Dementia Care
body:
My mother was recently in Ward 52 then transferred to an assessment unit. 3 days before she moved I took in a full bag of clothes including brand new underwear and trousers. By the time she got to the assessment unit she had only what she stood up in!  
During her stay in the hospital I had the opportunity to see inside the room where they keep patients clothes and they were all over the place. I also spoke to staff during that time who didn't know my mother had any other clothes as a result my mother spent 5 days in a hospital gown when her clothes lay in a cupboard and then wore the same things for days on end.  
A day before my mother was moved my brother was asked to go in and pick up a large bag of laundry but when he arrived he was given a bag with 1 item.  
I was shocked at the lack of both an efficient system and communication between staff. I understand why clothes are kept in a separate room but just because these patients have dementia does not mean you can treat them without dignity.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: pyxiswf38
title: Feels like discrimination
body:
I'm experiencing discrimination by staff who are brain washed by staff who I feel dislike me. Although I am making a lot of effort to be liked by every single staffs some realizes is propaganda against me and try to support me in any way they can but majority dislike me as a result and mistrust me. I know I'm a good person and i have a lot to offer but my mission goes unnoticed and in vain. I have never been on the ward where staffs are more bullying and very calculating and I feel like I play there games almost daily. My named nurse, ward manager and few individuals believe in and give me the benefit of the doubt which I find very encouraging and I feel good when they on shift. i am a genuine generous person but I find difficult to please these who doubt me.  
I would like to see change on the ward I am on, by having more diversity which gives hope to individual ethnic minority to tackle cultural insensitivity on the ward. I hope my story will be received seriously and make a difference.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: Kez100
title: Outstanding
body:
I attended A&E having suffered a hot oil burn. Absolutely outstanding! The Dr and Nurse were so lovely and had such an amazing Bedside Manner. Incredible. I was really scared but they made me feel so much better.  
Huge Thanks

author: bellzer
title: Organised and safe
body: I cycled through a puddle, which had a large hidden pothole, went over the handlebars of my bike, and got cut up quite badly. I limped home and my wife took me to the Vicky. Considering the current Covid restrictions, everything was organised and I felt safe. I was seen quite quickly. I was triaged, then cleaned up by John, who removed the stones from my wounds and bandaged me up. I was given clear instructions on how to change dressings, when to take pain relief, and what to expect over the coming days as regards the healing process and what to do if my wounds became infected. On top of that I felt that I was in good hands and managed to have a good chat while he worked on my cuts. All in all I had a great NHS experience, for which I am very grateful.

author: RonP
title: Positive outlook
body:
I was admitted to the hospital following a period of illness and falls.  
Dr Cargill and all his medical staff done an amazing job at reviewing my health needs whilst I was admitted to the ward. I have came home from hospital feeling the best I have done for a very long time with a more positive outlook on things. Thank you so very much.

author: Talking Rubbish
title: My Life back in my hands
body:
I was 14 when I started to use cannabis and after bullying through my teenage years, drugs became my coping strategy but taking my confidence and leaving me with mental health problems.  
I had periods where i would also add in alcohol and transfer but always returned to drugs as they made me 'normal'  
I have been in treatment for many years with no real change....I tried and tried and was at my end , months ago attempting suicide.  
CGL have been great and helped me so much to see who I am and supported me with advise on what changes I need to make and been there to guide me.  
My worker Steve, well what can I say he is an absolute diamond. He is fantastic and talks straight to me and has made me believe in myself and what i can achieve.. Just hearing his voice reminds me of this and motivates me to remain to be the person I have become.  
I am drug free and enjoying my 'new self and life'  
I have focus on me and have a new job and for once am living with my mental health without drugs.  
THANKYOU Steve and CGL.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: sculptorcf88
title: Failed Screening Appointment
body:
Following an consultation in December 2019 it was determined by the consultant and physio (both present) that I should have a revision MRI scan carried out on my spine to see if there had been any further issues in my spine that could be causing pain and weakness in my left leg.  
To date this scan has never happened (August 2020) and my condition is getting worse.  
I contacted the relevant department (PDRU Queen Elizabeth Glasgow) and was lied too initially, being told I was on a waiting list etc and would be allocated an appointment. It was only later on a second call it was confirmed that the referral had just been made in May 2020 and only because I had questioned the 5 month delay during the first call. So if I hadn’t queried it would have been lost in the system and I am now facing a longer wait through no fault of my own and ultimately through patient neglect. I had previous life saving spinal surgery in August 2015 which has left me with reduced function in my right leg so I do depend on my left leg. I had mentioned during the consultation in December that I felt I was losing strength in my left leg now and was concerned as it was my strong leg as such. This has deteriorated further since December with the leg feeling weaker, compromised and constant pain flowing through my spine, into my left bum cheek and down the leg.  
I feel let down by the system. I feel lied to and ultimately I feel scared that if there is an issue I am 8 months down the line, getting worse and no sign of an appointment for screening.  
If it turns out that my leg is damaged and it could have been prevented through earlier action, I will not hesitate to take this matter further.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: People Power
title: Wonderful A&E staff
body:
I'd like to express my thanks to the 2 men who called an ambulance and to the paramedics Kirsteen and Gale who came to my assistance on Saturday afternoon, when I'd a bigger seizure in "The Hidden Garden", ironically within Gartnavel Royal Hospital grounds, Glasgow.  
Also thanks to the wonderful A & E staff of the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital, who work tirelessly in these difficult times. Too often the N.H.S. staff are given abuse.  
So I'd like to re-address this & sing my praises for our wonderful N.H.S.

author: Basilmusic
title: Sent to wrong hospital
body: Appt.at Lincoln, sent to Boston then shoved back to Lincoln who had been waiting 7 hours for me. On discharge waited 7 and 1/2 hours for transport.

author: Andychef35
title: Dermatology appointment
body: Once I finally found my way to the correct department I was greeted in a nice a friendly way and led to receive my treatment by David and Lesley, they were fantastic, made me feel comfortable and safe.

title: Great practice
body: On arrival on Tuesday 4th August the care I received was second to none,we arrived just in time for me get an x ray which meant I didn’t Have to travel to chesterfield.by the time I arrived at my own hospital on Friday 7th everything was with the fracture clinic so a big thank you to you all .

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent experience
body: My son was admitted for an emergency appendicectomy. I can’t fault our experience. Padua ward was clean and very comfortable. I was able to sleep next to his bed and the ward staff made sure I was well looked after and fed as well as looking after my son. All the staff were friendly and helpful. As for the surgical team, well, wow! Such amazing people. They explained everything so well, reassured my son and I, were funny and friendly. They allowed me in to the theatre to be with him until he was asleep. The nursing staff monitored him closely after his surgery and our discharge the following day was smooth and speedy. We were in and out of the hospital in less than 24 hours. I can’t thank everyone enough, including the cleaners that came in to clean and the lady that took our food orders. Not at any point were we concerned about Covid 19. The hospital was taking all precautions which reassured us that our visit was safe. Our family are very grateful for the care and kindness my son and I received.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: Just been treated for a bump on my head. Brilliant service, receptionist and nurse were friendly and helpful. Thankyou for treating me today.

author: ldrek69
title: Hysterectomy experience
body:
My hysterectomy was scheduled for a Thursday in July 2020 at Forth Valley Royal Hospital, I self isolated for 2 weeks before as requested and had my pre op assessment on the Monday. During this appointment I was advised I would be allowed one visitor for 30 minutes per day as per the new SG guidance and track and trace paperwork would need to be completed.  
I arrived at the hospital on the Thursday morning, as I was taken to my room I was advised that I would not be allowed visitors as I was in a general surgery ward which was a blue zone...after a few tears and finally linking to hospital wifi I contacted my husband, there is no network reception within this hospital.  
The op went well and the care I received from staff was excellent,however, they were not equipped to deal with the particulars that go along with a gynaecological surgery, for example I was offered no relief for my trapped wind and my husband had to drop off peppermint tea, I was not showered during my 4 day stay and wound dressing only changed once, no advice regards surgical stockings and how long to wear them, no discharge pack or advice regards exercise or how to manage pain at home or follow up appointments.  
I was discharged on the Sunday with medication but no advice on recovery or contact numbers if I felt unwell or needed advice. Wednesday following I was readmitted with a fever and following tests an infection was diagnosed and antibiotics prescribed, discharged 5.30pm that Thursday, although the staff in Ward 6 gynae criticised my previous care in surgery, but again sent home with no info on recovery or what to expect.  
I am now 3 weeks post op and have a throbbing pain to the right of my vertical wound following a sub total hysterectomy, any info I have regards recovery and what to expect I have garnered from the internet and online support groups. I have no idea if a 6 week follow up will be sent out, if this pain I have is normal or when I can start to exercise more....in short I feel badly let down by NHS Forth Valley in their post op after care.

author: Gemmcm83
title: Awful interaction with a nurse
body:
I visited Wishaw general A&E dept for the minor injuries on Tuesday 4th August to have a swollen ankle / heel looked at. Receptionist was lovely and I booked in and waited to be see . After approx 20 mins my name was called and a nurse saw me through . I explained what had happened and why I decided to visit and after examining me sent me to x ray - I explained on numerous occasions it wasn’t my ankle that the pain was it was my heel  
But they insisted on an x ray on my ankle. Once I came back they were talking to another member of staff so I sat outside the office at the waiting area. The door was fully open and I heard them explain my visit to this colleague - my full name was discussed, my reason for visit- she proceeded to tell this staff member that 1. I advised my ankle was cut at point of injury (which it was) but I was lying as no cut seen I had explained it had healed 2. I was fat! - yes you read that correctly 3. I had driven myself to hospital so it couldn’t be that sore and 4. I was basically an inconvenience  
When they came out I explained I had heard everything and the attitude changed and suddenly was so nice wanting to show me my x ray and be kind to me.  
I am a 37 year old grown woman and was made to feel like an inconvenience to someone whose job it is to care for people.  
I am hurt, embarrassed and appalled with this and I will not be near Wishaw general again.

author: Joe52
title: The care my mum got
body: Our mum was admitted to FVRH to AAU2 where the staff were fab, our mum got moved on Thursday 16th July to A11. The staff in A11 were all fantastic from housekeepers/domestics, nursing assistants, staff nurses the charge nurse Craig to the Drs Dr Selwyn, Dr Ollie and Dr Wilson who all went above and beyond their duty. Nothing was a bother to them. We were told by Dr Wilson that mum was on pallative care and they just didn’t look after our mum they kept on asking if we needed anything. The last 3 nights of our mums life we spent at her bedside and the staff were always checking on our mum as well as my sister and myself. Craigs team is a credit to him they not only look after the patient in their care but also the patients family which we are truly grateful for

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Couldn’t fault
body:
We took our 3 year old to the walk in center yesterday after a accident on a playground. He was in severe pain holding his arm & was extremely upset. 
As soon as we entered to walk in center the very professional receptionist took our details & arrange to him to be seen immediately as she could see the serve distress he was in.
We then were taken into the treatment room by a lovely nurse who reassure me he has more then likely dislocated the ligaments in his elbow & called for a doctor. Within 2 minutes the lovely doctor has put is elbow back into place & he was a happy smiling pain free little boy. 
The professionalism by all staff at Leigh walk in center was to a very high standard & we could not recommend this service enough. 
If any of the staff are reading this - Thank you very much for what you did.

title: Simply Superb
body:
We attended A&E on Friday where my little girl was found to have broken her arm. From getting seen, to X-ray to a orthopaedic surgeon coming to chat to us was all done in a caring, compassionate and an informative way. 
We were booked into theatre on the Sunday and the care from all staff on Ward 17, the anesthetiser, orthopaedic surgeon and team in theatre, recovery and the porter was absolutely top class! You made a very worried mummy and very brave little girl feel comfortable and cared for! 
Not all superhero’s wear capes and you all are most definitely superhero’s! Thank you so much!!

title: Great Doctors/ Clinical staff, but no…
body:
I have been with this practice for about 20 years. And the doctors and clinical staff are very proffessional and competent.  The major problem here is there is a massive lack of appointments.  Phones lines open at 8 and you have to ring on the dot and even then, you are 15th in the queue.  Any later and you could be 30th in the queue.

I am writing  this review, because over the last 7 consecutive working days i have been ringing to get an appointment and after waiting roughly an hour each day, i have been told the same thing "Sorry, no more appointments, ring back tommorow 8am".  
I had eventually had to use the walk in center, at a primary care.

I feel too many patients have been accepted  in this surgery and there is a dire lack of doctors.  This is is an ongoing problem we have faced, even without Coronavirus, most of my family are registered  here and they have the same problem.

I do not want to change GP after 20 years, so do I just accept not being able to get an appointment?

title: Incredible staff and hospital
body:
We can not thank the Minor Injuries department (A&E) for their care and attention when I brought in my son last week. As visitors to the area, staying with my brother in York we were even more anxious to be bringing our 9 year old to A&E. The staff were so helpful and dealt with his care quickly.
The nurse who helped us in Minor Injuries was incredible. You could not have asked for a kinder person to look after my son. She was so friendly, calm and gentle. Thank you so very much for everything you did for us.
The hospital was so clean and we felt safe being there in these uncertain times. Every member of staff we met were friendly and helpful, all with a welcoming smile.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Slightly annoyed
title: The care I received during my cataract operation
body:
My first port of call was obviously reception at QMH Dunfermline cataract unit and I must say it was a bit unwelcoming.... seemed very abrupt with not a nice attitude... the staff member was I thought very snippy.... my nurse came out to meet/welcome me and was delightful, so efficient and with a very professional approach, an outstanding team player, very considerate and caring, explaining everything in detail, was lovely in comparison.... the other nurse I saw was excellent also... The doctor explained every detail and was very good.... ..........  
My usual doctor was as usual extraordinary, what a fantastic person with tremendous ability I must say.... overall a fabulous team effort, with the exception of the initial reception.

author: power2007
title: Very pleased
body: Very pleased with the care of all staff in the department, all very pleasant and professional and welcoming.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: MJMR
title: Helpful and polite
body:
Everything was very good.  
All staff was very helpful and polite.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ACard
title: Great staff
body:
My day in South Tyrone Hospital was very good, great staff, good food (although not much choice on menu). But what I received was quite good. I was made feel very comfortable by all members of staff.  
Thankyou for your care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Airy
title: Nurses couldn't do enough for you
body:
I am very happy with the set up at South Tyrone Hospital and all the nurses couldn't do enough for you.  
I feel safe here as there is good distance between me and the other patients.  
It is nice and airy.  
It is very handy for me to attend the clinic as I live close by.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: 123 k
title: Thanks to the staff, calm & reassuring
body:
I just wanted to say thank you for the excellent treatment my little boy received and continues to receive at the Children’s Hospital.  
He was asked to attend CDU and from there was admitted to ward 3C where he stayed for a week receiving treatment.  
The staff were all so kind and professional and we always felt well looked after.  
My little boy is only a baby and he was very ill and the staff were so calm and reassuring.  
All of this happened during the coronavirus outbreak and so there were lots of new processes to follow but at no point did we feel at risk. Thank you again

author: First-time-mum
title: Allowing partners into hospital
body: I was recently admitted to triage just after Aberdeen was put back into lockdown and partners were no longer allowed into the maternity hospital. I completely understand the rationale for this to minimise the number of people entering the building however it is extremely distressing as a patient when you are in severe pain so bad that you are struggling to walk to not be allowed to have your partner with you. My partner had to leave me at the door to the ward not knowing what was going to happen to me or our baby which was extremely upsetting for both my partner and myself as a first time mother and makes a scary situation even more frightening. I wish that in certain circumstances exceptions could be made for the well-being of patients. The staff were all lovely and did their best to make me feel at ease but it is not the same as having your partner to comfort you.

title: Blood Test
body:
The staff, both the receptionist and nurse, were very friendly once I got into the waiting area for the blood test, however I was appalled by the long wait to be seen (over an hour), bearing in mind this was standing along corridors. I was fortunate because I was one of the last to be allowed in, however, I was shocked to hear the reception just call out “no more after this lady” from the waiting room at 5:20pm. Most people didn’t hear her as many were queuing round the corner. They hadn’t taken any names/DOB/NHS numbers from anyone after ‘this lady’ so must have had some idea the rest weren’t going to be seen. It would have been nice to have warned them, rather than let them stand there with false hope. 
I appreciate it’s busy, but this would have been  a some gesture which would have been appreciated by many.
Having experienced these queues on many occasions, I wondered if appointments had been considered in the trust. I have just relocated from another trust where an appointment system was in place and you rarely waited more than a couple of minutes.
I reiterate the 1:1 conversations I had with the staff were all very friendly and they were very accommodating for me personally.

author: Diplo
title: Prescribed the same useless creams
body: I feel like they wouldn't be able to diagnose a dead cat. I have been seen every 3 to 6 months & prescribed the same useless creams, when the problem is internal. Scared to give steroid tablets, which helps with flare-ups. Nurses who talk about other things & it seems can't wait to go home. Disgraceful use of taxpayers money. Over 25 yrs I have going to them, never got rid of any of my problems.

title: Turned away from a walk in centre
body: Needed to see a Dr on a Sunday.  Went to the Bournemouth NHS walk in centre and was turned away because there were no appointments available??  What kind of logic is that??  Left in pain, disgusted at what had happened.  No wonder A&E is under so much pressure...

author: charlie12
title: The care my late father received
body:
I would just like to say that the care my father received in Ward 4 Forth Valley Hospital was so good. The staff supported in such a professional and caring manner my father and ourselves as a family in his last few days of life.  
I would like to say a big thank you to all the staff and doctors.

author: ERob44
title: Great care given
body:
Great care given, exceptionally good food  
Nurses second to none, very caring.  
Couldn't ask for better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Maye67
title: Looked after very well
body:
I received first class care and felt protected.  
I felt the care workers were overworked, and felt sorry for them wearing masks etc.in the heat.  
Even with all this I felt I was looked after very well.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice but  smear protocol needs…
body:
I had  a routine smear. Nurse was very pleasant but I felt I needed to write a review about my experience. 
I was surprised that there isn't a privacy curtain around the couch . I felt embarrassed undressing in front of nurse . I thought it was standard practice to have privacy curtains around couches  . 
Also paper wasn't offered as a covering  ( to make me less exposed  ) 
I think the protocol needs reviewing .

title: Pharmacy
body: Some time ago the former,reasonably comfortable waiting area was ruined by the addition of the Kildonan House pharmacy.  That area, well before the pandemic, now resembles Piccadily Circus, and anyone with hearing difficulties could well miss hearing their name called, most uncomfortable, and in my view wholly unnecessary as there was, and still is a perfectly good pharmacy directly opposite, Rowlands.   Not content with introducing such unfair competition it seems that now several patients when ordering prescriptions, normally collected at Rowlands, are finding that because of a "glitch" their prescriptions are going to Kildonan  House pharmacy and on checking with Rowlands it does seem that this "glitch" doesn't seem to work the other way.  So if you prefer to use Rowlands for your prescriptions make it clear that is where you expect it to be collected when ordering.

title: fantastic staff
body: can not recommend this place highly enough staff are fantastic nothing is to much trouble looked after my son who has autism let me stay with him all the time they were fantastic

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Not friendly. Long waiting times. Poor…
body:
Vine House medical center has been my doctors for years now, but only because it is local. The service is generally unfriendly. The booking processes available makes it hard to book appointments. The 'Online Consult' option only gets answered randomly. The last time I tried to use it the receptionist said on the phone when I have had no option but to call the practice to try to book to see or talk to a doctor. "They have seen it, but haven't actioned anything." Being left in the dark, waiting for a response that isn't going to come doesn't help the patient who may be going through all manner of sickness and pain etc... 
The waiting times for appointments is ridiculously long. Appointment availability is very poor. The modern building always appears woefully underutilized, which is not helping the appointment waiting times. So many rooms there which I have never seen used. I have never seen more than four people in the waiting room that is easily big enough for twenty five plus. If you are unwell or have a pain, you need to see a doctor. You may not consider yourself 'an emergency', but you would still like to be seen as quickly as possible. Unfortunately, as I have heard other people say who use this facility, the only way you can get to see a doctor within three weeks, is to try and book 'an emergency/urgent' appointment. Or try and phone in at 08:00 to try and get one of the couple of appointment slots available which is impossible, as everyone else is having to do the same, and usually you can't even get through because the lines are in use. If you are ill, unwell or in pain, you need to see a doctor within a day or two at the most, not have to wait two weeks or more after trying to eventually get a pre-booked routine appointment slot.  I really would not like to have had to write a review like this, but I am forever disappointed at how hard it is to simply see or even speak to a doctor and often simply get through to the practice. This practice has the ability to be so much more. However, I always end up feeling disappointed at the poor service on the occasions when I have needed them most.

title: Appalling way to treat patients
body: On the rare occasions I have managed to get through on the phones, staff constantly give mixed messages left right and centre. Numerous times I have had to go to the local walk in centre for treatment because I cannot get an appointment. Receptionist actually hung up on me today whilst I was trying to explain to her that I have changed my contact details. I am awaiting a specialist appointment on a very concerning issue that I am rightly very anxious about. They have accused me of lying about prescriptions which is ridiculous, I have been left without medication because they don’t communicate! GDPR is an absolute joke, they asked me to take a picture of my issue and send it via email which I was unwilling to do for privacy reasons and I was told that the doctor wouldn’t be able to contact me without one! Unprofessional, inadequate and a risk to the public!  I am moving to another practice!! A shame, as in fact the doctor and nurse I have seen (the two times in 7 years I’ve managed to get an appointment!!!!) are lovely!

title: Don't bother. On hold for over an hour!!
body:
This surgery is absolutely useless! They constantly forget to do my father's medication that he ordered, and the pharmacy ordered, and when you go to call them, you have the badly looped message saying they appreciate your call and won't keep you long.

I've now had over an hour of this nonsense.

title: Helpful and accommodating
body: Full attention given to my condition. Under the current difficult circumstances, a blood test and subsequent telephone consultation were speedily organised, reassurance given and referral onwards arranged.

title: Awful service! Avoid if possible
body:
I get the impression that these care workers simply just don’t care. I hope I never have to visit Queens hospital again. I visited the hospital in May 2019 and was made to feel like I was wasting their time, I was discharged back to my GP as it seemed to the doctors I was exaggerating. The next day I visited another hospital in London where I was admitted for 3 nights due to a serious long term, life threatening illness. 
15 months later and I’ve had a flare up of my illness so visited Queens again only to be dealt with by an arrogant doctor who clearly couldn’t care less. I’m sure my illness might not seem like an emergency to the doctor but to be treated in this way when I was nothing but polite makes me extremely angry. It’s safe to say that I will do everything I can in future to get to another hospital other than Queens.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Gone down hill
body: I’ve been with this practice for over 10 years and have since it decline over the years.  Waited 30 mins on the phone to make an appointment for my son and when I finally got through, I was told that they no longer do pre-booking appointments and that as all appointments for that day had gone to call back tomorrow morning, absolutely ridiculous!

title: DIFFICULT COMMUNICATION
body: I wrote to a senior GP in the practice on 25 July & have not had a reply.  They don't seem to have any regard for their patients. The telephone system needs an overhaul.  In view of the current lockdown there are no facilities for the GP to have a visual consultation.  Is there any authority I can complain to.

title: Blood tests
body:
My husband requires blood tests at least once a month requested by two hospital consultants. My husband is terminally ill. 
I now been informed that they have reduced the number of hone visit clinics and are struggling to make appointments. 
The people requiring home visits are the vulnerable people probably terminal and in need of care. 
Not happy!

title: Very efficient
body:
Well run organisation very friendly staff.

Went in for a second cataract operation and can only say the experience was as good as when I had my first one in March.
Would recommend this hospital to anyone.

title: Exceptional Care
body: My Aunt has been lucky in her long life not to have had much experience of hospitals and was naturally very apprehensive when she had to be admitted at short notice in July.  She was very impressed with the care she received from A&E through to the Digestive Centre. She was also very concerned when waiting to have an endoscopy, however the staff in the unit entertained her whilst she was waiting for the procedure and put her completely at her ease. Thanks to everyone involved.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Very impressed
body:
I am very impressed with how The Meads Surgery has responded to the changes required by the coronavirus pandemic. 
The Doctors and staff have continued to be efficient, friendly and responsive to patients needs.
Call handling has much improved of late and overall patient care and communications are top notch!

title: Happy with the staff involved in my child's…
body: Really pleased with the care received at the Royal National for my son who has an unusual condition called MSUD. The paediatricians and psychiatrists have been attentive and caring when it comes to helping him although the admin staff can sometimes be difficult to deal with. This is a very testing condition for a young person to have to live with and overall I am happy with the medical side of things so far in our visits to the Royal National.

title: Complaint
body: Tried to ring Detal Hospital today. 6th In the queue. When I did get through phone rang continuously for 10 minutes no one picked up. Rang again still no Reply. I am trying to ring to arrange an appointment.

title: A professional and obliging group of doctors
body: Detail is recorded and care is referred when needed. Receptionists usually obliging and helpful with urgency being recognised when needed.  Courteous and responsive.

title: Unhelpful
body: I have been registered with this gp since I arrived in the UK as they have a satellite staff health practice in addenbrookes. The staff health is brilliant and the Doctors as well but the the Petersfield Medical Practice is unhelpful. I completely understand the pressure as i worked for NHS myself. Most of the time I call, the receptionist are rude, they dont listen to your concerns, cut you off and do all the talking, and unemphatetic.

title: Unwelcoming
body: Felt very unwelcomed at barbara castle wag after attending an eye screening appointment with my mum. My mask accidentally fell off while talking to the nurse who then solded at both me and my mum. She said the virus wont stop because of you people. We are from a south asian background which makes us vulnerable to the virus. This made us feel very uncomfrtable. The nurse continued to tell us to fix our masks properly and refused to see us unless my mum had a 'proper mask' this was a verg bad experience

title: Cut off phone mid sentence
body: Wait 30min to book an appointment for myself and my daughter I manage to arrange a telephone appointment for myself in 10 days time I then start to explain that I need to book an appointment for my daughter and I am cut off mid sentence while I am talking as if I am done. Person does not even bother to listen to full sentence absolutely disgusting- Staff need better training.

title: Unprofessional Staffs
body:
I had last stage cancer, had severe side effects of chemotherapy on my left eye and when I tried to book an appointment that was not possible because of the currently pandemic situation (which is ok).

I had my phone appointment and the doctor told me to send all documents I had to them to be able to see a doctor, because in this case my eye need to be scanned. They said to me on a rude way ove the email (I have got the screenshot) that they are not able to help me and if I’m not happy I’m welcome to change the GP.

Never ever received such a rubbish treatment from NHS like that.

Extremely rude and unprofessional staffs!

title: Fantastic staff
body: I deal with the practice a lot and I cannot praise the Doctors enough. They are professional and caring and I feel that they go out of their way to ensure everything is done. It is a big relief having a good surgery.

title: Fantastic ward
body:
Just had to leave a review. The nursing staff in the cardiac wards were fantastic. Just to mention as well, the cardiac day centre. All the nursing staff went the extra mile. Very caring lovely nurses who were constantly sanitising everything. 
Absolutely first class treatment. The consultants and Doctors very professional and caring. A very special thank you to my named nurse and my pre assessment nurse who ran the extra mile for me.

author: Nanook
title: Drive-Through Phlebotomy
body:
My mum was required to have a blood test for her diabetic check-up/ appointment, however this was in the middle of the Covid-19 Pandemic and as my mum was shielding (due to health conditions) she didn't really want to go to our local GP surgery, especially as the Phlebotomist always struggles to get her blood sample. She was advised that she could attend the Drive-Through Phlebotomy service based at Sheffield Arena, instead of going to the local GP surgery or the Phlebotomy service at the Hallamshire Hospital were she would normally go (we were unsure if this was running or not anyway).  
So fast forward a few weeks, my mum decided to the Drive-Through Phlebotomy service and as she didn't drive, I (daughter) took her. She was understandably anxious about it and we decided to wear masks to give both us and the staff running the service an extra line of defence (we are in a pandemic, after all). Once we arrived if was clearly sign posted and the staff member who was directing cars in, was really friendly and helpful. We drove around to the service, which was all spaced out at 2 meters and the staff were in PPE.  
The Phlebotomist was really friendly, chatty and helped put my mum at ease. The Phlebotomist explained how things were done and why, she appreciated that we wore masks and she also understood that having your blood taken whilst putting your arm out of the car window is tricky. She helped my mum get comfortable in order to start taking blood. However after 2 attempts the Phlebotomist had no luck, and said she didn't want to keep trying any cause any unnecessary discomfort or pain, so asked for assistance from a senior member of staff. The senior Phlebotomist was also very friendly, chatty and explained everything. She managed to get the blood sample from my mum, and we were all able to have a joke about how strange it is to go for a Phlebotomist appointment in the car. All staff were friendly, patient and professional, The Drive-Through Phlebotomy Service was set-up very well and clearly followed all health and safety guidelines. It was so nice to use a service were everyone was friendly, professional and had a good sense of humour.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: great practice
body: the staff at trowbridge practice are kind, compassionate, and they care about their patients. the doctors and receptionists are helpful.

author: Bee3
title: True heroes & professionals
body:
In May this year my daughter had to be brought to A&E, from there she had facial surgery and then on the Maynard Ward overnight  
The Ambulance man called Billy who attended to us was nothing short of amazing, the most caring man who quickly settled us all.  
At A&E the nurses, doctors and consultants were all so caring, empathetic and understanding, a cup of tea and holding your hand can make the world of difference. In the face of a pandemic they continued to deliver the most humane and highest standard of care we are very lucky to have.  
My daughter had recovered marvelously well and I will be forever grateful to every single member of staff during this time at the Ulster Hospital, we never fully understood what we clapped for on a Thursday night until this happened, true heroes & professionals.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sad daughter in law
title: My father in law
body:
My father in law was brought in by ambulance, at first he was taken to the acute medical ward, then transferred to the Terling ward. The family were informed to get to the hospital as soon as possible as he only had few hrs left to live.  
I can only express my sincere thanks to the day and night staff who made such a traumatic time more bearable with their support and compassion. Sadly my father in law passed away peacefully after 3 days.

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Phone query
body:
Apparently it's acceptable to laugh down the phone to my wife when she phones up to query if you are allowing partners to attend 20 week scans!  Then to "huff" and say restrictions won't be lifted until a vaccine is found is also unacceptable.

We appreciate the current situation, but as other areas and hospitals are lifting their restrictions (Blackpool for example lifted their restrictions on June 15th) then it is a perfectly appropriate query and deserved more respect and professionalism from whomever picked up the phone.

Very disappointed in the service and so glad we have been going to private scans where we actually get treated with respect and dignity, not laughed at for asking a question!

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Great service
body:
I sadly had a bad fall last week which resulted in my needing to be seen for treatment.  This resulted in 3 visits over the course of 5 days.  I received true caring, empathetic and excellent nursing care! 

My only criticism would be that when I arrived late in the day admittedly, and I FULLY appreciate that your staff are in unprecedented times, but having gone through the questions at the door regarding fever etc......  to be thrown a piece of paper to complete with out telling me was unnecessary and rude! 

But thank you for such great care

title: Amazing Care
body:
I was admitted to Harefield for a triple bypass which was carried out 1st May 2020 . 
The way in which everything was handled pre admission and on admission was totally caring and professional and personal . It gave me the confidence to know I was going to be in good hands . The Surgeons are in my opinion the most highly skilled . The Nurses and Doctors too . The Admin staff and porters . Its like you are being looked after by real people who care about you , your well being ,and recovery .  If you are waiting for surgery at Harefield , have no concerns , you are in the best of places .  I cannot thank every one enough and would do so personally given the chance . Amazing people dedicated to what they do best.  The HDU post op and the wards are staffed with wonderful nurses . The pain management was superb throughout , in fact I do not recall having to say I was in pain at any time , such is the attentive care of the Doctors and nurses .
A big thank you to every one at Harefield what an amazing team .  Having to do this with the ever present threat of the covid 19 , well that makes you even more amazing .

readBy.name: Royal Brompton and Harefield NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic practice
body: I have been a patient of the Killick Street Health Centre for nearly 10 years and have always received excellent care there.  The team are friendly and professional, and there has been no problem accessing care when I need it.  I'm so grateful this is my local practice.

title: Always very helpful
body: I have always had wonderful service here.  The reception staff are always welcoming, friendly and very helpful. I have never had a problem getting an appointment when needed.

title: Friendly, efficient - great experience
body:
I came in for a smear test. This happened punctually and efficiently, and the nurse was friendly and professional. 

I asked the nurse to check some freckles which had been concerning me. She did this, but to give me peace of mind, asked a doctor to have a look. He put on the protective gear necessary, was with me within a couple of minutes, and examined me.

This examination had not been booked, but I was extremely impressed again by the friendly efficiency of the process.

Thank you all!

title: Great experience
body:
Over the past 5 years I have attended appointments at your Plastic Surgery Clinics and have been impressed by the service I have received following an SCC excised from my chest in March 2015.
I have been kept in touch with regular appointments and each attendance has provided me with reassurance and helpful advice.
During 'lockdown' I was contacted by staff to inform me of appointment changes plus my 'final' Dr telephone appointment.
Appointments have been largely kept to time and staff have kept me advised of predicted waiting times.
All staff have been friendly and helpful.
Each time I have been examined for any further lesions and have now been 'signed off'.

title: Don't Care for the well being of children
body: Our child has a fungal rash all over his body we only know it is a fungal rash because we had to take him to a walk in center because all the doctors want to do is telephone conversations and assumptions over the phone we had one of these over 2 weeks ago with the gp and he said it was probably  eczema or a viral infection and to give them a call back a week later. We did this and got treated the same way we did from the previous phone call saying they will get the doc to call, the rash had grown and got worse all over his body by now and i couldn't wait any longer for treatment so i took him to a drop in center to be seen to where i drove to the other side of Leeds for them to see him i got there and he was seen by a doctor who diagnosed him within minutes saying he needed cream and shampoo, the doctor also said that our doctors should of seen him as he is a child with a massive rash all over his body and they can not diagnose this stuff over a phone, Anyway i was happy now because he was getting the treatment he needed, the only thing is we didn't get prescribed enough cream to last a week so i got in touch with pharmacy they told me to ring docs, i phoned docs they told me to ring pharmacy, am getting confussed now because no one at gables surgery or pharmacy seem to know what to do because of the conflicting answers, we finally came up with an answer where i had to request more cream from there online portal, i did this phoned them back the receptionist said she had sent it through so i thought great i will get a phone call later to go pick it up from pharmacy. I didn't get one in fact i phoned them back 3 hours from requesting it and i got told the doctor needs to speak to us so he will ring us in the morning, my fear is now that it will come back over night and we will be back to square one, seems like a whole lot of trouble this to fix a Childs health don't you think. This practice seems to be sweeping things under the carpet and blaming coronavirus for the inconvenience but it wasn't an inconvenience for a walk in center to look at him at the other side of Leeds. Very poor care in this instance. I also don't understand why the doctor needs to phone us back when you can buy this certain cream over the counter, i wouldn't be asking for it if he didn't need it, i can see my child a whole lot better than a doctor can over the phone.

title: No communication!
body: Have had a procedure at this hospital I have waited over a month for the results and on chasing find they haven’t been passed on. As I have had heart and lung problems you might think I wouldn’t have to chase up answers myself and at this time of covid I really don’t need the added stress. The main switchboard always takes at least 5 minutes to answer. General communication seems very slow emails are used everywhere else why do we have to rely on phones and letters? No wonder it takes so long to get anything done!

title: Terrible service
body: Phone always engaged when you do finally get to speak to a receptionist they run the place can never get to see a doctor always fully booked I've had enough looking for another practice

title: Disappointed
body: I am having an acute abdominal pain and wanted to get my GP to check out my symptoms; it wasn't severe to call 999 or to go to the emergency Dept., but I knew that the type of pain can be indicative of some disease process: I was unable to get telephone service (poor reception in the village), so decided to walk to the Surgery to seek help.  Unfortunately, I had to 'go back home to call to book an appointment'.  I got a phone call from someone, called back, specified the symptoms that I was experiencing to the receptionist; in the end 'Dr. is going to call you for a phone consultation'.  'There is nothing else that could be done as Dr. is not seeing patients physically only phone consultation.' How can I get phone consultation when I don't have a functioning phone connection? This is what health care has resorted to In NHS? Is Covid 19 the only health condition and all other illnesses are sidelined  or is non existent? Very ridiculous.  So the end result, I am still in pain, I cant see a Dr., even if someone tries to reach me via phone I wont know because of connection issues.  So the solution, take some pain medicine over the counter, suppress the symptoms without finding the cause, and pray its not a surgical/ medical urgent condition.

title: Extremely poor community mental health care
body: As a carer for my mother who has unfortunately been under the care of CNWL for 5 years I have witnessed poor, negligent and at times dangerous care. I would strongly recommend considering using a different provider and think the service would benefit greatly from external review.

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great medical advice
body: Doctor few and doctor bastable, have given my health a great steer to the therapies my body needs, they have correctly put me in touch with the medical professionals I need to improve my quality of life I am forever grateful for their patience and diligence into sorting my ailments, a massive thank you to the doctors and the practice.

title: Very professional experience
body: Had a biopsy this morning. Perfect experience from reception to the actual procedure. I couldn’t rate the staff any higher. I would recommend the Dermatology department at Mortimer Street to any potential patients. Thank you.

title: Excellent service carried out in a friendly manner
body:
Excellent service and treatment carried out in a friendly but professional manner
I was created with care and respect at all times, i was kept updated constantly on plans for me and admitted without any problems, treatment on the ward (greville) was second to none. A huge thank you 
Gary Bowers

title: Appalled
body: I was originally booked to have surgery with this company but have been cancelled twice now. I requested a refund because the company could not be certain on a date. I was informed it would take 91 WORKING DAYS for a refund which I find disgusting. The company have not made me feel better in anyway possible. Poor service avoid at all costs so many bad reviews.

title: Excellent staff in Endoscopy
body:
I attended endoscopy for a colonoscopy on 6th August and I have to say from start to finish the staff were great. The whole department was run safely and the staff from reception to consultant made me feel completely at ease. I am extremely difficult to put a cannula in but the staff were great, even though it took multiple attempts and ended up in my foot. 
For a long time I haven’t had a good thing to say about the Manor Hospital so I was pleased, that on this occasion, I can give a positive review.

title: Outstanding practice
body:
I have had recent significant worrying Health symptoms taken seriously and calls to the Practice responded to within a day by telephone contacts. Following the description of my symptoms over the telephone to one of the doctors (show of blood and weeks of irregular bowel movements)  referral  to the colorectal department and  at UCH was made and a consultation and colonoscopy offered within a fortnight . 
At around the same time in July this year My GP was clearly extremely concerned about neurological issues which I have been experiencing for some time and about which I phoned the practice to discuss 
After a number of follow up telephone conversations about the nature of these symptoms and there not resolving , my GP insisted that I attend A& E at UCH immediately. 
So within a month I have had a colonoscopy and CT brain scan and neurological assessment. Other follow up   medical appointments are still to be attended 
This has been a very difficult and stressful time for me and the care, concern and with worrying symptoms being taken seriously has been most  reassuring and extremely helpful 
 My husband and I cannot overstate our appreciation of the care and clinical handling of health issues received over the 40 years we have been patients at the Practice 
The reception staff are professional and exceedingly helpful in setting up appointments and being supportive of anxieties .
We feel very fortunate to have such an outstanding NHS GP practice available to us. 
We remain so very thankful

title: Rude and insensitive receptionists
body:
On numerous occasions, the receptions have been rude, insensitive and unhelpful. There has been a lack of respect for confidentiality.  This applies on the phone and face to face and makes any simple process seem like a gigantic task. I can't recall a visit when I did not have this opinion. It's a great shame because it's in the heart of a very friendly community and the doctors that work there are excellent. 

Nowadays a visit to the GP only seems necessary when it's something serious but this surgery fails to show any empathy from the moment you walk through the door.  

It's a shame to say that despite living only a five minute walk away, this behaviour is making us consider finding another surgery further away.

title: Fab drs but rude and unhelpful receptionists
body:
Never had an issue with the drs at this surgery however I wish the same could be said about the receptionist. One of them is so rude and whilst trying to get an appointment for a gp to talk about my mental health I was made to feel as if I was a hinderance and she almost put me off seeking any help at all. 
Please doctors speak to your receptionists and teach them the skill of open communication and empathy! I have never felt so belittled or humiliated by anyone let alone by an untrained and unqualified ‘professional’ 
This type of draconian service went out in the 1950’s and has no place in modern medicine. 
My mental continues to deteriorate but thanks to this particular receptionist I am almost too scared to call back to seek support.

title: Good new system eConsult
body:
This morning I was advised to use the online eConsult system. Having completed the detailed form online with photos, later that afternoon I received a telephone call from the doctor. Explanation and diagnosis was given, with medication to collect the following morning. Very smooth and very efficient for all concerned. 
The next incremental system step will no doubt be to use Skype or Whatsap for a visual discussion/ consultation.
Good progress.
                         Ian Adams

author: Estepario
title: Covid-19 in Italy
body: I travelled to South of Italy in the last week of March and the virus started to spread in the north of Italy that week, when I returned to UK my manager told me that he didn't know if I was allowed to work and he told me to call 111 to ask for advice. I was given Covid-19 information. Perfect.

title: Impressed by care and  support
body: I have been extremely impressed by the level of care and support extended to my entire family since March and throughout coronavirus. We have each needed very different help from the practice during this time and have had our concerns treated quickly with respect and efficiency. We have had stressful times and never felt alone as we knew we could contact the practice and a GP would be available to help us. Having GPs arranging a time to call us and check up on how things were progressing was very reassuring too. I want to thank you for everything,  especially during this incredibly stressful time of coronavirus.

author: Patient0223
title: No Covid-19 screening
body:
I was told I would be contacted by phone on the day of my appointment to go through Covid-19 screening questions. This did not happen.  
I arrived at the medical centre and approached the receptionist. They asked my name and told me to take a seat. There were no Covid-19 screening questions again. The reception area is the responsibility of the Practice the scan was delivered by Yorkshire Health Solutions.  
I was collected from the waiting area by a member of staff, no idea what their role was or their name as there was no introduction. It was a case of “follow me” as they raced ahead of me.  
In the clinic room, again no Covid-19 screening questions or checks. No introductions so again I don’t know who did my scan or what grade of staff they were.  
There are so many Covid-19 screening processes in place in local hospitals I was shocked to see so little interest in Covid-19 at this medical centre. There was some signage up, the receptionist wore a mask, the clinical person had additional PPE and the reception desk was surrounded by chairs presumably to create a barrier between them and the risk that patients could present with Covid-19. Perhaps do some screening before patients attend to reduce the risk as opposed to spending your time building a barricade around the reception desk.  
Please introduce yourselves and ensure your identification badges are visible at all times. Make yourselves aware of the Hello My Name Is campaign because it really does highlight the importance of the little things, like introducing yourself.

author: GrannieRee
title: Recent Stroke
body:
I felt unwell - my right arm and leg weren’t working so I telephoned my Drs and was offered a phone appointment  
The dr telephoned me I gave my symptoms and he suggested I attend Stranraer and E which I did up there I was told to wait I was eventually sent for CT scan and bloods were taken an A&E dr came to me after, and I can remember my blood pressure was high 197/123, snd they leaned back on wall and said I was fine and could go home.  
I went to my daughter's house and my husband came after his work and returned to our house  
The next morning still dragging my leg and arm I said to him I didn’t feel well and he took me to my daughters by lunch time she strongly suggested I telephoned Drs again and again I waited and got called by someone from Loch Ree Practice at Waverley medical centre  
The dr listened to me but said they couldn’t understand me being released with such high blood pressure and asked to speak to my daughter as my speech was incoherent.  
He was contacting Stroke unit Dumfries hospital  
They telephoned and asked me to attend the following afternoon.  
By the evening I could still manage to toilet and got into bed  
The next morning I was unable to do anything this was torture  
My husband along with help from friends got me into car we drove 75 miles to Dumfries hospital on arrival my husband parked in emergency bay got a wheelchair to put me in he was struggling to get me from car when an ambulance turned up the staff were amazing they got me into chair and told him to leave car where it was and get me into the hospital  
We proceeded to appointment where I was taken through to see the doctor who said I’d had a full stroke and that from my records they couldn’t understand why I wasn’t sent to them at my first hospital visit.  
The treatment I received in Dumfries was amazing  
I had the chance to be transferred 5 days later to Stranraer Galloway hospital where staff and Drs on Dalrymple ward were again fantastic  
I was discharged on Tuesday 23rd June to home  
I had Stars attend every day am and pm but they stopped after three weeks I was unsure but the OT said I needed to have confidence in my self still to this day I won’t use shower on my own. It was suggested that I telephone someone and got them to call me back 30 mins later to check I was ok.  
Physio came once a week but not been in last two weeks, OH the same I haven’t seen them in two weeks.  
I feel abandoned to get on myself even when I telephoned Drs they say well you've had a stroke ...I know but I feel I should get supported.  
I’m only 57, my mum passed aged 61 from stroke.  
I've had high blood pressure for years but was made to feel I exaggerated it the aches and pains I have fibromyalgia so it was always put down to that. I’ve had other incidents at A&E Stranraer compartment syndrome which nurses told me dr was being too cautious sending me down blue lighted turned out I did have it and delay could of cost me my leg. On another occasion I attended after slipping on the ferry from Ireland and went up X-ray but told me legs not broke just sprained. Kept returning to Drs in agony one time I was told to report back to A&E but the nurse said I didn’t need re X-rayed I just had to cope, two weeks later my dr sent me to X-ray dept and turned out I had a broken leg.  
I feel so frustrated I’m now unable to walk unaided my speech is slow I have some movement back but upper right arms agony my mouth is full of ulcers I find it hard to swallow everything tastes of cardboard but I’m struggling with the anger, hurt, shame of having to ask for help my husband is fantastic and luckily I have friends who are able to check on me food wise etc  
I feel so let down surely this shouldn’t have happened and now need answers. I know COVID 19 isn’t helping but surely I should be getting support from NHS.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Letdownjuly20
title: Only the doctor seemed to care
body:
Sadly I had to attend Eden for blood tests due to a possible miscarriage. I had an appointment and buzzed the door to attend, when I was let through a support worker came up to me, didn’t ask my name or make any introductions and just shoved a tympanic thermometer in my ear and then shouted back to the front desk my temperature. It took me by surprise to say the least!  
Then barked at me to go and wash my hands, I was apologetic that I hadn’t seen the sink and the signs behind all the boxes in the corridor. None of the staff spoke to me or asked if I was ok. I then waited in the waiting room which isn’t exactly calming or reassuring for women who are attending only for miscarriages, terminations and other horrible gynae related issues. You would think that given the sadness of the ward that the staff would at least try to be kind and empathetic. The doctor called me through to the treatment room and took my blood, and was lovely, actually the only member of staff who spoke to me like a person and not treated me like a task.  
The treatment room had blood all up the examination lamp with a big handprint on the top and there was blood on the drip stand. I felt like I was sitting in the scene of something pretty horrid. Once my bloods were done the doctor showed me out.  
I’m a nurse, and I work in the hospital and I would never treat a patient the way I was treated, they should be ashamed of themselves. They knew why I was attending and I had managed to keep it together for my appointment but inside my heart was breaking and only the doctor seemed to care. Terrible terrible care, I hope I never have to go there again.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Disappointed of Nottingham
title: Attitude of staff at local CMHT
body:
Before I go into the story I want to acknowledge that we are all living in difficult times and it affects us all individually in different ways.  
I have to attend my local Community Mental Health Team base every fourth week for a Depot injection. Since lock down we have to book an appointment as Clinics as I understand it have been suspended. The last few times when I have rang I have been unfortunate enough to be answered by a receptionist who talks to you like you are a 5 year old. This week I tried to return a call to the centre but they wouldn't put me through and spoke in a patronising way. When I did eventually made it to get my injection I had to wait outside the building for 10 minutes (luckily it was a nice warm and dry day)while the nurse prepared the injection. My disappointment and anxiety from having to wait was enhanced after the encounter with a nurse who can only have spoken to me at the most 20 words. But NONE of those were asking me how I was. Forgive me if I am wrong but surely as mental health nurses their patients welfare should be up near the top of the list when speaking to them. The fact that I didn't know the nurse is irrelevant if this is a new member of staff surely its a way of getting to know the patients. I have recently gone through and still am struggling. It was obvious my notes hadn't been looked at.  
Previously I had known a lot of the staff there but they all seem to have moved on. I can only say how disappointed I am in the treatment I have received lately. It has not given me any faith in the team. After speaking to a support worker who tried to say that all was well. It certainly doesn't feel it to me. I have put my story on here because I don't want to make a formal complaint (I am not like that) however if the attitude doesn't change my only way may have to formalise my disappointment.

author: Mow Mary Maureen
title: A wonderful job
body:
I attended Hairmyres for cataract and stent surgery to my left eye. I was nervous, but from the moment my son dropped me off at the door to be escorted to the waiting area all the staff were effective, efficient and friendly. The Covid regulations were exemplary. The offer of coffee and biscuits friendly. The interview with the surgical team carried out professionally and in a personal level. The trip to the operating theatre accompanied by a knowledgeable young theatre assistant did wonders for my confidence and lessening my nerves. The surgical team were wonderful patient with my sometimes failure to understand their requests. The after care and offer of a coffee and sandwich was well received.  
Contacting my lift home and escorting me to the door completed the total care package.  
May I offer my total thanks to all of the team who assisted me on this day.  
Thank you one and all, you do a wonderful job in trying circumstances.

author: BCH50
title: Care and compassion
body: My Dad was admitted to Crosshouse Hospital to the Combined Assessment Centre and then to the ICU at the end of July, 2020 and sadly passed away. The care, compassion and professionalism of all the staff was exceptional. Staff communicated with us to keep us appraised of my Dad’s condition and supported us when we had to make the difficult decision to withdraw support. Having had a terrible experience 4 years earlier when my Mum passed away, there was a huge difference. Can’t’ thank the staff enough for making a difficult time more bearable.

author: Brightspark39
title: Sore lump on scalp
body: David and Leanne did a superb job putting me at ease before the biopsy and making it as pain free as possible. The wound was a bit sore that evening (but no more than the lump would have been) and was almost pain free by the next morning. Thanks again.

author: mask lady
title: Emergency admission
body: From first responders, through accident & emergency dept and then ward 13 short stay medical unit I was treated with the utmost respect, compassion and professionalism. This was all despite everyone being busy and in the midst of such change during this Covid-19 pandemic. I felt safe in all their hands when at my most vulnerable. I witnessed great teamwork from medics, nurses, auxiliary nurses, porters, support services, cardiac physiologists & radiographers. I was kept informed and felt part of the decisions made about my care. Well done and a big thank you to the paramedics and Staff at UHD.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Milly the cat
title: Seeming lack of care
body:
Elderly neighbour was admitted in lockdown with mini-stroke, had nil contact with anyone with covid symptoms. He was admitted few times over April and may re mini stroke, eye focus issues, kept for couple of days each time, then sent home to local community, nil hospital support. Last time was given covid test, but sent home, son had to chase result, eventually told was positive, gentleman admitted again with increased confusion and now chest infection. He in hospital care, then local community hosp, then back to hospital, and now has died.  
I do not think he should have been sent home to local community, nil result, neighbours doing all, shopping, sending in Sunday lunch, trying to help him.I feel he must have contracted Covid in the hospital.  
Fortunately nil neighbours contracted this.  
I as a neighbour, and retired nurse am extremely annoyed, concerned re your lack of communication, care and more, and also feel shame that I was trained in this trust.  
I am also very concerned and upset that as I live in this area, that my immediate family and myself will be subjected to your lack of care now and in the future  
Thank you or not, for your seeming lack of care, I will be prepared for more challenges re my family care or lack of same!

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: sunnyb
title: Excellent care during a worrying time
body:
I recently had to undergo surgery in surgical ward 2 in causeway Coleraine.  
I was very nervous . from the time I arrived to the time I left I cannot thank the staff enough. I was greeted in the morning by a nurse called Karen who showed me to room C . later that morning the ward sister Debbie came in to see all the patients and to check if everything was ok . she knew that I was nervous and spent time reassuring me , During my stay she checked in on us all when on shift. her staff work well together . the laughter was lovely to hear she has a friendly ward . I would like to say how caring all the staff were . even though they wore masks they were all cheery . and put us all at ease . the ward has a lovely feel with everyone working as a team even though it is very busy you could feel and hear a happy team at work.  
Aaron Danni Helen Karen Louise Danielle Olivia Mellissa thelma were some of the staff I met there were a few more but their names fail me so apologies for missing some .  
thank you again for helping me through a very scary time

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Constructive observer
title: The birth of our daughter
body: I gave birth to our beautiful daughter in Aberdeen Maternity Hospital Midwife Unit. From the second my husband and I entered the unit we were supported and cared for excellently. Our desires and preferences were always put first and we felt that our experience was totally unique and catered for us. Despite the current restrictions and strains this must inevitably put on the staff, they showed no sign of it and were the perfect balance of professional and personal throughout our time in the unit. Sarah (midwife) and Sarah (student midwife) were the ideal team encouraging and supporting me through 12 hours of labour in the fabulous birthing pool. Followed by Gemma who brought our gorgeous girl into the world. We will never forget any of those precious moments they helped us to create.

author: Bilboey
title: No one should be treated like this
body: My Grandma went to A&E because she believed she broke her little toe 2 days previously, she has been in a lot of pain with it and it's been keeping her awake. It's taken her two days to go get it checked because she thought she just bruised it and she's never been one to want to go bother doctors. But she finally gave in to the pain and went to A& E which is practically next door to her home. She was dealt by a Nurse who was extremely rude and made her feel really small, saying she should not of come to A&E because her toe was not sticking outwards, in a very rude tone and the words "you're wasting our time" were used. The way she was spoken to, was disgusting, didn't give much eye contact at all, barely acknowledging her, rushed her out after taping her toe. Implied that she should've known that they don't x-ray toes that aren't sticking out... Like my Grandma was a trained NHS worker. It's honestly angered me because it's meant to be a place to get help and support, no one should be treated like this.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
